Episodes.Title: The General Flipped at Dawn
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: A visiting general, appearing to be more eccentric than the usual army brass and a stickler for regulations, tries to move the camp closer to the front and court martial Hawkeye before they discover that he's completely loony.

Episodes.Title: Rainbow Bridge
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Laurence Marks, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and Trapper are Tokyo-bound, Frank is jealous; but Trapper wants 3 days without amputating something. Father and Henry bring shopping lists but Radar brings news of more casualties. Thirty-six hours and 473 cases later (an...

Episodes.Title: Officer of the Day
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Assigned by Frank Burns as Officer of the Day in Henry's absence, Hawkeye must deal with the daily 4077th chaos and try to thwart sneaky Col. Flagg's plans for his Korean prisoner.

Episodes.Title: Iron Guts Kelly
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Sid Dorfman, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: General Robert "Iron Guts" Kelly arrives for an inspection and dies in Margaret's tent, prompting his aide Colonel Wortman to do damage control and make it look as if Kelly died in combat.

Episodes.Title: O.R.
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Laurence Marks, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Drama, pathos and humor combine when heavy casualties result in a long session in the O.R.

Episodes.Title: Springtime
Episodes.Writer: Linda Bloodworth-Thomason, Mary Kay Place, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: It is a beautiful Spring day that makes one yearn for a group lobotomy. Trapper grabs a nurse; Radar wants to grab pretty Lt. Simmons and Henry grabs some golf. In the field, nostrils flare as Hotlips and Frank grab each other. A ...

Episodes.Title: Check-Up
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Trapper John's ulcer flares up and could provide grounds for a medical discharge from the Army.

Episodes.Title: Life with Father
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Henry suspects his wife is having an affair, Hawkeye searches for presidents' faces to try to win a pony and Father Mulcahy officiates at a Jewish Bris with the help of a rabbi on a faraway aircraft carrier.

Episodes.Title: Alcoholics Unanimous
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: When Henry goes to Tokyo for a conference, Frank outlaws alcoholic beverages, dismantles the still, and enlists Father Mulcahy to present a sermon on the evils of drink. But Frank discovers that drying out the 4077th isn't so easy.

Episodes.Title: There Is Nothing Like a Nurse
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: After a run-in with Major Houlihan, Henry is not altogether unhappy when the nurses are evacuated due to a possible enemy attack but soon finds out with rest of the camp just how much the nurses mean to the unit.

Episodes.Title: Adam's Ribs
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: After literally being fed up with mess hall food, Hawkeye goes on a desperate quest to order barbecue spare ribs from his favorite restaurant, Adam's Ribs, at Dearborn Station in Chicago.

Episodes.Title: A Full Rich Day
Episodes.Writer: John D. Hess, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye records a letter to his Dad, detailing the exploits of a mad Turkish soldier, the loss of a Luxembourg Lieutenant's corpse, and a lieutenant's strong-arm tactics to obtain medical care for a comrade.

Episodes.Title: Mad Dogs and Servicemen
Episodes.Writer: Linda Bloodworth-Thomason, Mary Kay Place, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Against Frank's objections, Hawkeye and Trapper treat a young, shell-shocked GI with hysterical paralysis while Henry searches for a possibly rabid dog that bit Radar.

Episodes.Title: Private Charles Lamb
Episodes.Writer: Sid Dorfman, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: When the 4077th is invited to share an Easter meal with a Greek unit, tender-hearted Radar comes up with a creative way to save the main course...a lamb!

Episodes.Title: Bombed
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: While Radar tries to stop the camp from being shelled by their own artillery, Frank finds a wounded enemy soldier wired to explode, Margaret and Trapper get stuck in a supply shed and Henry and Father Mulcahy get blown up in the l...

Episodes.Title: Bulletin Board
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Simon Muntner, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Trapper writes a letter to his daughter, Shirley Temple dances, and the 4077th tries to take a mental break from GIs suffering from hypothermia and post-op bleeding by throwing a benefit picnic for the orphanage.

Episodes.Title: The Consultant
Episodes.Writer: Robert Klane, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye learns more than just a new surgical technique when a casual conversation in a Tokyo bar with a medical consultant convinces the man to come to the 4077th.

Episodes.Title: House Arrest
Episodes.Writer: James Fritzell, Everett Greenbaum, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: After Hawkeye makes an insulting remark about Margaret, Frank snaps him with a towel and Hawkeye responds with a nicely placed right cross to Frank's eye. Hawkeye is then placed under house arrest and instead of being treated like...

Episodes.Title: Aid Station
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Simon Muntner, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye, Margaret, and Klinger travel to an aid station at the front, where they end up working closely together under heavy fire and unsanitary medical conditions.

Episodes.Title: Love and Marriage
Episodes.Writer: Arthur Julian, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and Trapper try to unite a Korean medic with his family in spite of Frank's interference and find out that a young GI isn't telling the whole truth about his upcoming marriage to a Korean woman.

Episodes.Title: Big Mac
Episodes.Writer: Laurence Marks, Larry Gelbart, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The camp prepares for a visit from General Douglas MacArthur, but Klinger interrupts the proceedings with his attempts to earn a Section 8 discharge.

Episodes.Title: Payday
Episodes.Writer: John W. Regier, Gary Markowitz, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: A clerical error results in an unexpected payday windfall for Hawkeye and the ire of a zealous payroll clerk.

Episodes.Title: White Gold
Episodes.Writer: Larry Gelbart, Simon Muntner, Richard Hooker
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: The attempted theft of penicillin from the 4077th by a group of suspected black marketeers brings Col. Flagg to investigate.

Episodes.Title: Abyssinia, Henry
Episodes.Writer: Everett Greenbaum, James Fritzell, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Wayne Rogers, McLean Stevenson
Episodes.Plot: Henry finds out he's been discharged from the army and everyone at the 4077th prepares to say goodbye to him as he heads home.
